author: Special Correspondent
text:
Assam Chief Minister Tarun Gogoi, along with his wife Doley Gogoi, filing his nomination from the Titabor constituency in Jorhat district of Assam on Friday.- Photo: Ritu Raj Konwar

The Congress on Friday fielded former Union Minister Deepa Dasmunsi against West Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee from the Bhawanipore Assembly constituency.

The candidature of Ms. Dasmunsi, wife of veteran Congress leader from West Bengal Priyaranjan Dasmunshi, assumes significance as State Congress president Adhir Ranjan Chowdhury had on March 8 said that Congress leader and Jadavpur University Professor Omprakash Mishra would contest from the same constituency.

However, the Congress central leadership decided to field Ms. Dasmunsi, who had earlier represented the Raiganj Lok Sabha constituency.

Ms. Dasmunsi has been a staunch critic of Ms. Banerjee. After the announcement, Professor Mishra, who played an important role in forging the Congress-Left alliance in the State, withdrew from the electoral contest and wished success for Ms. Dasmunsi.

The other names on the list include Congress leader Amitava Chakraborty from the Shyampur constituency in Howrah, Abdul Mannan from Champdani in Hooghly district, and Sankar Singh from Ranahghat Uttar Paschim in Nadia district.

The Congress had earlier announced candidates for 43 seats, and with 42 names announced on Friday, the number of candidates in the fray increased to 85.

The party is likely to announce candidate for 10 more seats, which includes the prestigious Chowringhee constituency.
title: Deepa to take on Mamata
